result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Reason:  The defendant has now completed and complied with all requirements of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cathleen A. Mcleod

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cathleen A. Mcleod
Current: 1733 Fremont Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-10-2018)
Prior: 2225 Sims Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Status conference on July 9, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cathleen A. Mcleod in court with attorney James Michael Klein. Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:02 p.m. Assistant District Attorney  (ADA) Wetzsteon calls the case and states the appearances.
ADA Wetzsteon states the status of the case for the record.
ADA Wetzsteon states Ms. Mcleod has been working on the 3 incomplete areas of the deferred prosecution and requests matter be set for a Status Conference on 07/09/2018 at 8:30 a.m. If all condtions have been met, ADA Wetzsteon to file an Order for Dismissal.
Atty Klein concurs.

BY THE COURT:
Matter is set for Status Conference on 07/09/2018 at 8:30 a.m.
  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 13, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Cathleen A. Mcleod in court. Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:50 a.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.
State has filed a motion to vacate the DPA and states the reasons on the record for vacating.
State indicates that upon revocation of the DPA that this case would then proceed to sentencing.
Court makes statements with regards to the defendant signing and agreeing with the DPA entered into of August 2016.
DPA had been extended upon the defendant's request and she has failed to complete the DPA requirements.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not want to be heard.
Court questions the defendant if she has spoke with her Attorney.  
Defendant would like to speak with her attorney.
State would like to get a sentencing date as soon as possible.
Defendant is informed that she will need to make application again with the public defenders office.

BY THE COURT:
DPA is revoked.
Defendant to make application with the public defender's office.
Parties will go to Br 2 JA to get a sentencing date set.

ADDRESS INFO for Cathleen A. Mcleod
Current: 2225 Sims Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2018)
Prior: 1649 A Main Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Notice of Motion and Motion to Vacate Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed by ADA RW

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Prosecution Agreement-Extension **extended for an additional 3 months until November 8, 2017

ADDRESS INFO for Cathleen A. Mcleod
Current: 1649 A Main Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2016)
Prior: 1733 Fremont Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Cathleen A. Mcleod in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:28 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State complied with victim right's notification; no statement submitted or appearance at today's court hearing.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 -
**Deferred Prosecution Agreement 
*See DPA for conditions as stated on the record
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cathleen A. Mcleod in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the parties. 

Warrant was cancelled on 6/27/16.  Matter set for a status conference today.
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.   
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cathleen A. Mcleod not in court, defendant in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:25 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.
Atty Constable states a warrant had been issued as the defendant failed to appear for a hearing.
Atty Constable indicates that a DPA had been offered but still failed to appear.
Court questions the defendant as to why she failed to appear at her previous hearing.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.


BY THE COURT:  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
